intro: Gastrolychnis involucrata subsp. tenella, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gastrolychnis, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, compound leaves with a distinctive pinnate structure. The flowers are typically small and clustered in umbels, a common feature among plants in this family. The subspecies tenella is distinguished by its narrower leaves and shorter inflorescences compared to the typical form. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky habitats.
